noun.description: Any of several attractively variegated kinds of wood used especially in cabinet work, especially that of the cabbage-bark tree or angelin, Andira inermis; (also) the wood of an Australian cabbage palm, Livistona inermis, and of the Venezuelan tree Caesalpinia granadillo (family Caesalpiniaceae (Leguminosae)).
A speckled condition in the heartwood of oak resulting from infection by the basidiomycete fungus Stereum frustulatum.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in John Lindley (1799–1865), botanist and horticulturist. From partridge + wood.
